item.title: Slicing Time at Scale: Building a Cloud-Native Data Engineering SDK in Scala (on GCP)
item.description:
“When scale knocks, APIs shouldn’t break. They should smile back.”

🧠 Intro – Data Engineering at Scale: The Real Deal

Forget the buzzwords and “intro to Spark” tutorials. Real Data Engineering at scale is a beast that chews through naïve assumptions, burns your cloud credits, and laughs at your YAML configs.

This blog isn’t a primer. It’s a battle-tested story—how we built a cloud-native SDK in Scala on GCP to tame petabyte lakes, orchestrate CDC without ACID, and whisper to partitions so you only scan what actually changed.

item.title: How I Cut Delivery Errors by 82% Without Losing My Sanity
item.description:
🚨 The Problem: Errors Everywhere

At my organization, we were shipping data pipelines faster than ever—but the delivery error rate stayed stubbornly around 12%, which meant:

  • 😓 Manual rollbacks, dashboards showing stale or missing data
  • 👎 Frustrated teams notifying stakeholders (and me) daily
  • 🕒 A few hours lost per incident, every day

It wasn’t sustainable—and I’d had enough.

🎯 The Goal

Implement a self-healing pipeline with:

  • Automated quality gates
  • Full pipeline rollback on failure
  • Clear ownership via data contracts
  • Faster failed-job detection

And yes, keep my sanity intact.

item.title: Cloud-native AI workflows - BigQuery ML Vertex AI for cloud-native AI pipelines
item.description:
🚀 Why cloud-native ai workflows matter

Gone are the days when ML meant “export to CSV, train locally, drop results into spreadsheet.” Today, you want models closer to data, less friction, and faster iteration. That’s where BigQuery ML + Vertex AI shine—no data movement, built-in MLOps, SQL-first modeling, Python API for custom steps, and powerful pipelines to tie it all together.

This post walks through:

  • bigquery data prep + bqml modeling
  • registering models in vertex ai model registry
  • deploying real-time endpoints
  • building automated pipelines
  • monitoring and feature store integration

item.title: Forecasting at scale: A deep dive into Demand Prediction with Random Forest and Neural Networks on a datalake
item.description:
🎯 Why this post exists

Inventory decisions are where strategy meets survival. Demand forecasting isn’t just a data science problem—it’s the heartbeat of retail, logistics, and supply chain optimization.

This post tells the story of how we built a modular, scalable Demand Forecasting Platform that uses Random Forest, Artificial Neural Networks, and Hybrid Time Series models—all running on top of a robust Data Lake infrastructure powered by Apache Hadoop and Spark.
